reviewText: On September 25th, 2012, we lost a music legend to bladder cancer. That next day, we went to his Moon River Theater & Grill in Branson, Missouri. We had already planned the visit, the week before his passing. At the gift shop at his theater, they had this DVD collection & I bought it. It is a great collection of musical performances from Andy Williams. It was worth every penny I spent! "Moon River" is a timeless song that should be played & enjoyed by people of every generation. "Dear Heart" makes a perfect dinner song. On the first DVD called "Moon River & Me" you will get to see Andy from his Moon River Theater, introduce you to some of his favorite performances he did. See Andy sing with other musical legends on the Duet DVD & then when the holidays arrive, watch Andy Williams Christmas DVD! If you ever go to Branson, Missouri, please go visit his theater & also go to the Moon River Grill. You will find Andy's Gold & Platinum records above the bar. He also has pictures & special paintings all over the place. Andy Williams, we will miss you! (Andy Williams 1927-2012)
summary: A Great Way To Remember Andy Williams Forever!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I agree with everyone else -  its Andy Williams, there's great guests and the video quality is also great, considering when it's from. My only complaint is that there is no option to watch w/o the dialogue. In case you do not know, before every single song, we the viewer gets a history lesson about the next performance. The first time around, it is interesting & informative and sort of nice to hear Andy's take on things. Sure, it's informative & sentimental but after watching the dvd's a couple times, it is slightly(increasingly?) annoying as it breaks the flow... Not to mention, I prefer seeing the younger Andy...There could have easily been an option to "watch videos only". So, a big 5 stars for Andy & the amazing guests, but 3 stars for the DVD's format = 4 stars. All in all, I highly recommend!

reviewText: I don't even remember those quality 'variety shows'.Yet,thanks to 'YouTube',you can see the various musical shows from yesterday.I had ordered this dvd,and it was well worth watching.So many talented singers,from their twilight years or those just arising to stardom.'The Andy Williams Collection' is perfect to watch,and see all the stars of yesteryear shine.Sadly,music shows today are rehashing old tunes.The classical lyrics are clear and the songs smooth honey-flowing.Some of the teeny glam bands can't be understood.Thesedays,the words are even more banal and the music manufactured simply to sell for a fast buck.The classics are still the best.Enjoy this dvd!
summary: Musical snapshot of a great variety show+

reviewText: All one needs to know... I'll say it again: The performance in 1968 of Simon, Garfunkel & Williams together singing a "Scarborough Fair/Canticle" triad, is worth the purchase price alone.It is a guarantee that all the other great artists on this set are also fantastic... but for me, Scarborough Fair had never been performed this well before, nor will it ever be performed this well again.
summary: Simon, Garfunkel & Williams alone are worth the Price.

reviewText: I have loved this artist since I was in high school and each morning after his show I would talk about it with my friends at school. We bought his albums and played them and listened to them on the local radio station, "Top 60" each Saturday. We bought the sheet music of our favorites and learned to play them on the pianos in our homes. I felt very bad when I heard he died and went directly to Amazon to buy his music. I was pleased to find DVD's of some of his great shows. This is truly an Andy Williams dream set. I loved listening to him sing the signature song that he ended each show. Tears flowed hearing his wonderful voice and seeing something long past come back to life on a DVD.

reviewText: I know it is easy to say that something has been lost from TV entertainment. Maybe this is a generational thing; it is more than simply the passing of the times. The Andy Williams Show - like so many other entertainment shows of that time - was a time when we as a family would sit as a family and enjoy family time. The passing of the times should not have destroyed that. It has. We do not make the time just to sit and enjoy. Mind you, today's 'reality' shows are NOT something I sit down to enjoy. In fact I do not sit down with them at all. Thus purchasing this set now means that simplest of life's pleasures remains possible. By the time I had watched this once, I wanted more...
Title: N/A
